comment: I had heard about Professor Rogers through one of my best friends growing up and she spoke highly of her. I really like her personality and who she is as a person, she is easy to understand. However, coming out of high school & ending pre-calc with a 100 I expected to do much better than I did. My advice: go to class, ask questions, and do the hw.

If math is not your subject, attendance is recommended, because she is very helpful in lectures. However, if thats not the case with you, she posts all notes online and the homework website can basically teach the class to you. Shes great though, always down to help.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Rogers is overall a great professor. She really cares about what she does which makes the class fun. She assigns a lot of homework which is hard to keep up with because she always changes the date. You have 3 skips but thats it. Very great teacher!

Overall good teacher, she can be cluttered at times. She does change dates when homework and test are due. Not a heavy load of homework. Test are super easy.. I have made nothing than a low A on her test and exams. Will say when you don't understand something, she becomes rude. She belittles you. Makes it uncomfortable to ask questions.

This was the easiest class I have ever taken in high school or college. The tests and quizzes are super easy and sometime she'll give you a 100 for a quiz grade for just showing up. Take her for an easy A requiring little effort on your part.

the class was generally easy and mostly self explanatory. honestly 90% of the material i learned during this course was from the textbook/online resources/classmates. she postponed most of the assignments and exams. i'd highly recommend looking over material before each class or at least printing out the online notes to be ready for class.

Easiest class I have ever taken hands down, She is a very good teacher, and explains the concepts in a way that are easy to understand. She also drops some of your low quiz and homework grades at the end of the semester. I recommend taking her.

VERY RUDE! STAY AWAY!!! This professor is very unorganized when it comes to due dates and test dates. She will say somethings due one day and then keep changing due dates. On top of that she also forgets the changes she made. She is terrible as answering questions. It's like she gets annoyed that you don't understand right away.

Professor Rogers is an awesome teacher! She knows what she is talking about and makes math easy. You have five test, MML homework, and twelve quizzes (she drops two of the lowest grades on quizzes). Super easy, just come to class and pay attention. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

She's a good teacher, class isn't too hard as long as you pay attention. Lots of stuff in MyMathLab for practice and homework, she takes the 20 highest homework grades and drops several quizzes. 4 tests and a cumulative final which wasn't too hard. My only complaint is we didn't know our overall grades until right before the final.

Great professor. Helpful. Don't be afraid to ask for help on a test or quiz, because she will basically give you the answers. Make sure you do the online homework, quizzes, and test when she assigns them. She can be inflexible if she didn't mention there was a quiz online, but it's posted. Several people got 0's. Drops a bunch of quiz grades though
Ms. Rogers was a great professor. She was always willing to go out of her way to help her students and explained the information in everyway possible. I really enjoyed coming to her class.

Pretty helpful teacher. The only complaints I'd have is that she can be a bit inflexible when she insists on teaching the peculiar way she understands/does problems, has at least one extremely confounding question per test, and can be a bit rude on a few occasions. Show up to class and be sure to pay attention to how she explains things.

If you are reading this, SIGN UP FOR THIS CLASS. Mrs. Rogers is awesome. 4 tests, 1 final, about 2 quizzes for each chapter (she drops 2 lowest quiz grades and half of them are like take home). Infinite attempts on homework. This is math we pretty much learned sophomore year of high school. She's also got a cool personality. 10/10 would recommend

She is a good teacher! Very nice and approachable. Knows what she is talking about and doesn't get frustrated when you ask a question. Do NOT buy the hardcopy book, just buy the online version. You have to get it for homework and quizzes. Take her if you can! Got an A+! Be sure to come to class. She checks on random days and gives extra credit.

Took in the summer. I really liked her class. She is fun and the whole class worked together which made it go by fast. Kind of felt like a lab environment. Homework weekly but is easy and many quizzes are open note, take home or with a partner. Her tests are very easy and I have test anxiety BUT I like math a lot so I know that may give me an edge.

She is a very nice lady and LOVES Math! She really is willing to help you, as long as you are willing to work hard. She will drop some quizzes and replace a low or missed test grade with that section from the final!

She is very nice and willing to always help! With that being said, she can get frustrated if you ask a question. Tests are not too difficult, but I found them to be quite challenging since I am not that good at math. It is very possible to make a good grade, but it involves a very good amount of work. She is nice and helpful and loves math.
She was a wonderful teacher! Always there to help you and will never make you feel dumb. We did not use the book just the manipulative's and notes. Take her class and you won't be disappointed!
Mrs. Rogers is the nicest teacher ever. She really wants to make sure her students understand the content. Tests are open book or take home. NO HOMEWORK. Don't buy the book.
Great and Fun Teacher. She knows a lot about her subject and is very willing to help and explain until you get it. I recommend her.

Half the class is spent on working problems and the other going over the problem as a class. Teacher is good but I learned more from the girl next to me than the teacher. All test/quizzes open book/note even final. Final was the hardest thing in the class so after it was a shock when I went to take it after so much easy work. Def study for final.

You must attend class, and there are pop quizzes that are pretty easy, and she usually lets you work with classmates. There are a few exams, and so far they have all been take-home. A few homework assignments, but nothing too stressful. If you are big on participating, she will love you aka "a teacher's pet."

Really helpful,clear,&enthusiastic,a very nice lady.Answers any quest thoroughly and clearly always willing to help.Didnt really need bk.Online quizes and hw that u can take until u make 100,if ur that lazy she drops lowest grade.Tests easy if u knew stuff.Attendance gives u easy extra pts.Made an A in her class.
Great professor.  Took her for a summer class.  Test are a little tough but overall it was an easy class.  Would take her again.

Wonderful teacher!  Does lots of hands on activities.  She is very nice and wants to make math interesting and understandable.  One of the most enthusastic math teachers I've had!  Would take her again!

Mrs. Rogers is an amazing teacher! The class was very interesting and she did a great job getting us to see what learning math is like for little kids. She gives "homework" but it isn't mandatory, it is only for us to practice, and she never asks for it. Tests are hard but reasonable. Great teacher and I learned a lot! I highly recommend her!
